translations.english_saheeh: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
translations.english_hilali_khan: I swear by the Day of Resurrection.
translations.english_rwwad: I swear by the Day of Resurrection,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1800]- i.e., that of the believer, which blames him when he falls into sin or error.

translations.english_saheeh: And I swear by the reproaching soul[1800] [to the certainty of resurrection].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And I swear by the self-reproaching person (a believer).
translations.english_rwwad: and I swear by the self-reproaching soul!

translations.english_saheeh: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Does man (a disbeliever) think that We shall not assemble his bones?
translations.english_rwwad: Does man think that We cannot reassemble his bones?

arabic_text: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.75:4) Each human being has his or her own special finger prints not resembling anyone else, indicating that our Lord (Allâh) is the Most Superior Creator of everything: Lâ ilâha illâ Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He).

translations.english_saheeh: Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Yes, We are Able to put together in perfect order the tips of his fingers.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: In fact, We are able to restore even his very fingertips.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1801]- Literally, "to sin ahead of him."  This refers to the disbeliever, who denies the Day of Account.

translations.english_saheeh: But man desires to continue in sin.[1801]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! Man (denies Resurrection and Reckoning. So he) desires to continue committing sins.
translations.english_rwwad: But man desires to persists in his evil ways,

translations.english_saheeh: He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: He asks: "When will be this Day of Resurrection?"
translations.english_rwwad: and asks [mockingly], “When is the Day of Resurrection?”

translations.english_saheeh: So when vision is dazzled.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So, when the sight shall be dazed.
translations.english_rwwad: But when eyes are dazzled,

translations.english_saheeh: And the moon darkens.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the moon will be eclipsed.
translations.english_rwwad: and the moon is darkened,

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.75:9) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The sun and the moon will be folded up (or joined together or deprived of their lights) on the Day of Resurrection." (See the Qur’ân 75:9) (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Hadith No.422).

translations.english_saheeh: And the sun and the moon are joined,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the sun and moon will be joined together (by going one into the other or folded up or deprived of their light).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: and the sun and the moon are brought together,

translations.english_saheeh: Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: On that Day man will say: "Where (is the refuge) to flee?"
translations.english_rwwad: on that Day man will say, “Where is the escape?”

translations.english_saheeh: No! There is no refuge.
translations.english_hilali_khan: No! There is no refuge!
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed! There will be no refuge.

translations.english_saheeh: To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Unto your Lord (Alone) will be the place of rest that Day.
translations.english_rwwad: On that Day all will end up before your Lord.

arabic_text: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
phonetic: 75.13 Yunabba'u Al-'Insānu Yawma'idhin Bimā Qaddama Wa 'Akhkhara

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1802]- i.e., his deeds, which await him in the Hereafter.
[1803]- i.e., that which he did not do or which he delayed.

translations.english_saheeh: Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead[1802] and kept back.[1803]
translations.english_hilali_khan: On that Day man will be informed of what he sent forward (of his evil good deeds), and what he left behind (of his good or evil traditions).
translations.english_rwwad: On that Day man will be informed of what he has sent forth and left behind.

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,[1804]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! Man will be a witness against himself [as his body parts (skin, hands, legs, etc.) will speak about his deeds],
translations.english_rwwad: In fact, man will be a witness against himself,

translations.english_saheeh: Even if he presents his excuses.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Though he may put forth his excuses (to cover his evil deeds).
translations.english_rwwad: despite the excuses he may put forward.

arabic_text: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
phonetic: 75.16 Lā Tuĥarrik Bihi Lisānaka Lita`jala Bihi

translations.english_saheeh: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muḥammad], to hasten with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Move not your tongue concerning (the Qur’ân, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) to make haste therewith.
translations.english_rwwad: Do not move your tongue [O Prophet] in haste trying to memorize it.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It is for Us to collect it and to give you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) the ability to recite it (the Qur’ân).
translations.english_rwwad: It is upon Us to make you memorize and recite it.

translations.english_saheeh: So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when We have recited it to you [O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم through Jibrîl (Gabriel)], then follow its (the Qur’an’s) recital.
translations.english_rwwad: Then when We recite it [through Gabriel], follow its recitation attentively;

translations.english_saheeh: Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then it is for Us (Allâh) to make it clear (to you).
translations.english_rwwad: then it is upon Us to explain its meanings.

translations.english_saheeh: No! But you [i.e., mankind] love the immediate
translations.english_hilali_khan: Not [as you think, that you (mankind) will not be resurrected and recompensed for your deeds], but you (men) love the present life of this world,
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed! You [people] love this fleeting world,

translations.english_saheeh: And leave [i.e., neglect] the Hereafter.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And neglect the Hereafter.
translations.english_rwwad: and neglect the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Some faces that Day shall be Nâdirah (shining and radiant).
translations.english_rwwad: On that Day some faces will be bright,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1805]- The people of Paradise will actually see their Creator in the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: Looking at their Lord.[1805]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Looking at their Lord (Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: looking at their Lord.

translations.english_saheeh: And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And some faces, that Day, will be Bâsirah (dark, gloomy, frowning, and sad),
translations.english_rwwad: And on that Day, some faces will be gloomy,

translations.english_saheeh: Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thinking that some calamity is about to fall on them.
translations.english_rwwad: knowing that a crushing calamity will befall them.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1806]- At the time it is about to leave the body when one is on the verge of death.

translations.english_saheeh: No! When it [i.e., the soul] has reached the collar bones[1806]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, when (the soul) reaches to the collar bone (i.e. up to the throat in its exit),
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, when the soul reaches the throat,

translations.english_saheeh: And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And it will be said: "Who can cure him (and save him from death)?"
translations.english_rwwad: and it is said, “Is there any healer?”

translations.english_saheeh: And he [i.e., the dying one] is certain that it is the [time of] separation
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he (the dying person) will conclude that it was (the time) of parting (death);
translations.english_rwwad: And he realizes that it is time to depart,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1807]- From the difficulties the person faces at death or his sudden awareness of the realities of both this world and the Hereafter.  It may also refer to his shrouding after death.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.75:29) Or it may mean: hardship and distress will be joined with another hardship and distress (i.e. distress of death, and of the thought as to what is going to happen to him in the Hereafter). (Tafsîr At-Tabarî ).

translations.english_saheeh: And the leg is wound about the leg,[1807]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And one leg will be joined with another leg (shrouded).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: when legs are brought together [in a shroud];

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1808]- Literally, "driving" or "herding" or "the place to which one is driven."

translations.english_saheeh: To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.[1808]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The drive will be, on that Day, to your Lord (Allâh)!
translations.english_rwwad: on that Day, he will be driven to your Lord.

translations.english_saheeh: And he [i.e., the disbeliever] had not believed, nor had he prayed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So he (the disbeliever) neither believed (in this Qur’ân and in the Message of Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) nor prayed!
translations.english_rwwad: He neither believed nor prayed;

translations.english_saheeh: But [instead], he denied and turned away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But on the contrary, he belied (this Qur’ân and the Message of Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) and turned away!
translations.english_rwwad: rather he denied and turned away,

translations.english_saheeh: And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he walked in conceit (full pride) to his family admiring himself!
translations.english_rwwad: then went swaggering to his people,

translations.english_saheeh: Woe to you, and woe!
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe to you [O man], and woe!

translations.english_saheeh: Then woe to you, and woe!
translations.english_hilali_khan: Again, woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you!
translations.english_rwwad: Again, woe to you, and woe!

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1809]- i.e., to no end, without responsibility, or without being returned to the Creator for judgement.

translations.english_saheeh: Does man think that he will be left neglected?[1809]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Does man think that he will be left neglected (without being punished or rewarded for the obligatory duties enjoined by his Lord Allâh on him)?
translations.english_rwwad: Does man think that he will be left neglected?

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ

translations.english_saheeh: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Was he not a Nutfah (mixed male and female sexual discharge) of semen emitted (poured forth)?
translations.english_rwwad: Was he not once a drop of semen emitted,

translations.english_saheeh: Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allāh] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he became an ‘Alaqah (a clot); then (Allâh) shaped and fashioned (him) in due proportion.[2]
translations.english_rwwad: then he became a clinging clot, then He created him and perfected his form,

phonetic: 75.39 Faja`ala Minhu Az-Zawjayni Adh-Dhakara Wa Al-'Unthá

translations.english_saheeh: And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And made of him two sexes, male and female.
translations.english_rwwad: and made from him both genders, male and female?

arabic_text: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ

translations.english_saheeh: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is not He (Allâh Who does that) Able to give life to the dead? (Yes! He is Able to do all things).
translations.english_rwwad: Is not He able to bring the dead back to life?
